Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 125 years and today has one of the world's largest news gathering operations globally. It produces leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Factiva, Barron's, MarketWatch, Financial News, DJX, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, and Dow Jones VentureSource.Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (NASDAQ: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).


The Wall Street Journal is one of the biggest news media with 2.8 million copies published everyday. The mobile team is building the next generation of mobile apps for all of these brands and the apps will be delivered to millions of subscribers around the world. You have potential and are impactful. You are passionate about technology, user experience and storytelling. You take challenges and are always eager to learn new technologies and try to solve difficult problems. You strive to solve these problems in a scalable, reusable fashion.

You are a front-end engineer, with hands-on native mobile experience in media delivery, including audio and video. You are someone who frequently takes the lead on important projects, and you are committed to working within thoughtful team processes. You're looking for more than just another engineering job. You firmly believe in the public mission of journalism and its importance in our society. You want your work to have an impact.


Design, develop, and test mobile applications for The Wall Street Journal and all Dow Jones brands.

Work with journalists, designers, data scientists, product managers and other engineers to build solutions to all newsroom challenges.

Keep an eye on technical innovations and changing trends in the mobile landscape.


1+ years of iOS native Mobile development experience. Swift or SwiftUI is preferred.

Familiar with data structure, system design, design patterns, API designs, MVC or MVVM, react, declarative UI, Git, and DevOps.

Experience developing with native video streaming SDKs [AVFoundation, AVKit] is a plus.

Full stack background is a huge plus.

Familiarity with cloud services, GraphQL, Firebase, etc is also a plus.

A passion for news and creativity to introduce new ideas and technologies. If you have a background in journalism, even better!

Bachelor's Degree.
